result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawna L Sperber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of synthetic cannabinoid, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to jail time in 14-CM-149, 14-CM-163 and 15-CM-71. Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 10/24/16 at 3:00 pm.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution in file 15-CM-071 plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

supervisions.notes: Huber release and good time granted. Credit for time served. To commence forthwith.
To pay the costs of the action. 60 days to pay costs or set up payment plan with Clerk of Courts office.
Court converts restitution owing to a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shawna L Sperber in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Shawna L Sperber in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 19, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Shawna L Sperber in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Shawna L Sperber in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Agent Kim Bridenhagen indicates DOC is still investigating the new charges for Ms. Sperber, indicates DOC is leaning toward revocation. Court won't set another probation review hearing, will wait to hear from DOC.
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Shawna L Sperber appears by video along with attorney Jeff Cano appears by phone.  Defendant Shawna L Sperber in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance. Atty Cano indicates defendant is currently on a probation hold, reserves bail argument until Atty Gerbers is available. Court adjourns matter until 10/31/16, cancels warrant.  Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Shawna L Sperber not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Non appearance by defendant. Probation agent Sara Siefert present in court. Court reviews events in file. Agent Siefert passes along information from Agent Bridenhagen on what's been happening with defendant in the last few weeks. Atty Gerbers has no information as to defendants whereabout. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant Shawna L Sperber in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Shawna L Sperber in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Shawna L Sperber in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Shawna L Sperber in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates defendant is accepting the State's offer, probation is being revoked on another case also. Atty Gerbers requests a status in a couple weeks to allow him time to talk to the State about a global offer to resolve both matters. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Shawna L Sperber in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Shawna L Sperber in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect. Status conference 3/14/16 at 3:00 pm.
by Bev Sperber.
from ADA Korb requesting matter be rescheduled to allow time for the evidence to be tested and obtain the results. Court reschedules.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Shawna L Sperber appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicates she doesn't qualify for PD representation. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 4/20/15 at 10:00 am.
